panels.description: Free capacity on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_kbytesinfo_free" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name'  AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.title: Free Capacity

panels.description: Used capacity on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_kbytesinfo_used" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name'  AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.description: The used capacity for each user.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_filesinfo_free" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name'  AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.description: Used Inode Number on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_filesinfo_used" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name'  AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.title: Used Inode Number

panels.description: The I/O throughput on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_stats_bytes-fs_name-ost_index" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "optype" = 'write' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.title: I/O Throughput

panels.description: The write throughput on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_stats_bytes-fs_name-optype-ost_index" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "optype" = 'write' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.title: Write Throughput

panels.description: The read throughput on this OST.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_stats_bytes-fs_name-optype-ost_index" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "optype" = 'write' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "ost_index"

panels.title: Read Throughput

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '1_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter
SELECT "sum" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '2_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter
SELECT "sum" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '4_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Write Bulk RPC Rate per Size
Size Distribution of Write Bulk RPC

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '1_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter
SELECT "sum" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '2_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter
SELECT "sum" FROM "ost_brw_stats_rpc_bulk_samples" WHERE "size" = '4_pages' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index' AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Read Bulk RPC Rate per Size
Size Distribution of Read Bulk RPC

panels.description: If the next page to be written or read in the I/O is not with the next offset, that page is a discontinuous page. There could be multiple discontinuous pages in an I/O. I/Os with less discontinuous pages are more friendly to OSDs.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_page_discontiguous_rpc_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Discontinuous Pages in Each Write I/O

panels.description: If the next page to be written or read in the I/O is not with the next offset, that page is a discontinuous page. There could be multiple discontinuous pages in an I/O. I/Os with less discontinuous pages are more friendly to OSDs.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_page_discontiguous_rpc_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Discontinuous Pages in Each Read I/O

panels.description: If the next block to be written or read in the I/O is not with the next offset, that block is a discontinuous block. There could be multiple discontinuous block in an I/O. I/Os with less discontinuous blocks are more friendly to OSDs. One page contains multiple blocks. The block size is determined by underline file system (Ldiskfs or ZFS).

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_brw_stats_block_discontiguous_rpc_samples" WHERE ("fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Discontinuous Blocks in Each Write I/O

panels.description: If the next block to be written or read in the I/O is not with the next offset, that block is a discontinuous block. There could be multiple discontinuous block in an I/O. I/Os with less discontinuous blocks are more friendly to OSDs. One page contains multiple blocks. The block size is determined by underline file system (Ldiskfs or ZFS).

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "ost_brw_stats_block_discontiguous_rpc_samples" WHERE ("fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Discontinuous Blocks in Each Read I/O

panels.description: Sometimes an I/O is not able to be written/read in a single BIO on OST,  instead, multiple BIOs are submitted. The fragment number of this I/O equals to the BIO number. Usually, less fragments in the I/Os mean better performance.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_fragmented_io_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Fragments in Each Write I/O

panels.description: Sometimes an I/O is not able to be written/read in a single BIO on OST,  instead, multiple BIOs are submitted. The fragment number of this I/O equals to the BIO number. Usually, less fragments in the I/Os mean better performance.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_fragmented_io_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Fragments in Each Read I/O

panels.description: The in-flight I/O number means the BIO that have started but not ended yet. Thus, when starting a BIO, the in-flight I/O increases. By contrast, when a BIO ends, the in-flight I/O number decreases. And when starting a BIO, the current in-flight I/O number will be collected. More in-flight I/Os means more concurrent I/Os on this OST, and thus heavier load for the OST.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_in_flight_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of In-fight Write I/O Number when Starting Each Write I/O

panels.description: The in-flight I/O number means the BIO that have started but not ended yet. Thus, when starting a BIO, the in-flight I/O increases. By contrast, when a BIO ends, the in-flight I/O number decreases. And when starting a BIO, the current in-flight I/O number will be collected. More in-flight I/Os means more concurrent I/Os on this OST, and thus heavier load for the OST.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_in_flight_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of In-fight Read I/O Number when Starting Each Read I/O

panels.description: The I/O time is the elasped time length between an I/O (Not BIO. A single I/O could sumbit multiple BIOs) starts and ends. Less I/O time of course is better.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_time_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Write I/O Time

panels.description: The I/O time is the elasped time length between an I/O (Not BIO. A single I/O could sumbit multiple BIOs) starts and ends. Less I/O time of course is better.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_time_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Read I/O Time

panels.description: The I/O size on disk is the size of submitted BIO. Usually, bigger I/O size means better performance.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_size_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'write_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Write I/O Size on Disk

panels.description: The I/O size is the size of submitted BIO. Usually, bigger I/O size means better performance.

targets.query: SELECT "sum" FROM "cqm_ost_brw_stats_io_size_samples-field-fs_name-size" WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "field" = 'read_sample' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "size"

panels.title: Distribution of Read I/O Size on Disk

panels.description: The write throughput for each client.
panels.title: Write Throughput per Client

panels.description: The read throughput for each client.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "exp_ost_stats_bytes" WHERE ("fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND "optype" = 'read' AND "ost_index" = '$ost_index') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "exp_client"

panels.title: Read Throughput per Client

targets.query: SELECT sum("sum") FROM "cqm_ost_jobstats_bytes" WHERE ( "optype" = 'sum_write_bytes' OR "optype" = 'sum_read_bytes' ) AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "job_id" fill(null)
SELECT sum("sum") FROM "cqm_ost_jobstats_bytes" WHERE "optype" = 'sum_write_bytes' AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "job_id" fill(null)
SELECT sum("sum") FROM "cqm_ost_jobstats_bytes" WHERE ( "optype" = 'sum_write_bytes' OR "optype" = 'sum_read_bytes' ) AND "fs_name" = '$fs_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "job_id" fill(null)

panels.description: LDLM lock number allocated on this OST.
panels.title: LDLM Lock Count

panels.description: Number of times this OST evicted clients due to lack of reply to ASTs.
panels.title: LDLM Lock Timeouts

panels.description: When Lustre OST/MDT service re-mounted, a recovery process will be started to recover the connections to the clients.
panels.title: Number of Recovery Clients

list.label: Filesystem Name
list.name: fs_name
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "ost_kbytesinfo_free" WITH KEY = fs_name

list.label: OST Index
list.name: ost_index
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "ost_kbytesinfo_free" WITH KEY = ost_index WHERE "fs_name" = '$fs_name'
